list_definition.definition: an injury caused by a blow to a person or a fruit, turning the skin a dark colour/color

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has bruises all over his legs
The apples were covered in bruises.

list_definition.definition: to cause or develop such a mark on the skin

list_ex_of_english: Because they will be handled heavily in the process of packaging, transporting and displaying, only varieties resistant to bruising can be marketed this way.
Not all illegal residents suffer mere cuts, bruises, or other maladies that can be patched up and the patient sent merrily on his or her way.
The bruises and lumps were still fresh and unhealed on his face.
Injuries included cuts, sprains, bruises and one case of fracture.
However, a slight bruising of my little toe was caused by page 53.
If it were possible to form these broken, bruised and sick men into a procession in ranks four deep, it would stretch 40½ miles.
There were bodies with bruises which could have been caused by handling after death.
Additionally, she has a heel sore and bruises very easily.
